comments.body: I think it should be the other way around. When you place a Nether portal, the Nether starts to leak into your world. The leak will only contain Netherrack and lava so if you want glowstone/quartz you have to actually go into the Nether.
That is one of the best ideas I have ever heard, but maybe if it was around the ruins of natural nether portals? Or maybe when you make a nether portal it starts to leak?

Too overpowered. Exploding beds is confirmed to be staying in the game and the lack of water is the point of the nether. Itâ€™s about taking away a necessity so you are forced to be more cautious and stuff like that.
Oh my god I love this!!!!! It should go both ways too, that would make portal rooms way more interesting!!

You can do most of this by bringing dirt to the nether along with any saplings you want, berry bushes and a single grass block. It results it a diverse forest with any vegetation that doesn't rely on water. Personally I always like to do this as a long term project and usually include deserts and a automated chicken spawner. Please try to do this instead as I love the creation of my sanctuary in the nether.

I like the idea of gravel mounds or even a new biome for them to go with it, dont think ancient dust is a good idea as it will make netherite too easy to make as well as further discouraging nether underground mining as its the only block so far worth going underground for. Could perhaps add some other resource in the mounds, or even better make it a home for a new termite-like nether mob.
What does it look like?
This is perfect! It adds more quirkiness to the cities. Perhaps these buildings could hang over the void with good loot at the end to add more danger to the journey.
maybe in the flowers there can be pollen blocks which bees can pollinate. the pollen dropped from the bees will be more yellow and will grow crops faster than normal pollen particles
Great idea
These could be found in an overgrown flower forest biome, alongside a new giant beehive structure.
Please expand on this idea. what would it look like, would there be an actual dragon in the lair? And what loot would be found in the lair
Maybe the red dragon?
This could fit in a cave update! A great cavern with a dragon sleeping on a heap, gold and other precious gems which doesn't exist yet.

I like the idea of a dragon layer, but perhaps it is a structure that generates once in the end for every dragon that is summoned (for some reason when I use/kill @e[type=ender_dragon] it kills 9 entities...) it could generate in the small end islands, and have more dragon eggs and a pile of gold. When you revive the dragon, another den is created.
The boss seems too ambitious of an idea for the structure. Plus the vex staff isn't too good of an idea in my opinion. An army of vexes in PVP would be annoying.
The boss sounds more like some kind of Herobrine and i donâ€™t think itâ€™s a good idea to have him respawnt again. What will actually hapen when you Trow the totem of undying in lava?
Please put it
Please put it please
Let wait

It should be made of new hinges, redstone and wood slabs, hinges are crafted from redstone and sticky pistons

Recipes
S: sticky piston
R: redstone dust
W: wood slabs
H: hinges

Hinges:
  S  
S R S
  R  
Drawbridge:
W W H
W W R
W W H

You should be able to join drawbridges and they will move as one. To activate a drawbridge, power it with redstone.
On the topic of castles, there should also be portcullis, cannons and secret passage blocks that blend in with the surrounding blocks.
No cannons please.

also its needs to be in the ice spikes biome and its needs a boss

if the boss killed it will drop the snow orb so you can activate it then you will be affected with the ice and snow effect witch it makes the player don't die when on lava also, he has some generations and health boost
Very cool and creative idea! You have my vote!!ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜€
pretty nice idea
Good Idea

Blazes work pretty well as a "ranged defense" of Nether Fortresses already.

This just seems really strange to me.  It just doesn't seem to fit in the game.  The only things that can automatically attack you in the game are mobs.  There are traps in Jungle Temples, but those are basic redstone contraptions.
interesting idea, but I feel as though there should more than 2 or 3.
Better than actual wither skeletons.
It wuld be a circle and then goos dieper down with an other circle
Yes! 1.20 already seems to be focusing on giving more uses to things such as bamboo, so why not use the bamboo wood to support a jungle village to use the unused jungle villager skin.
This would be a great use for the jungle villager variant.

Also wanted to add an optional feature. Once a piglin champion has been killed by the player, they will be granted a new status effect called Champion of the Nether/Bastion/Piglins that will make all piglins including the piglin brutes passive to the player. This effect also grants better loot drops when bartering with a piglin. This effect only lasts 100 mins and could also possibly have levels with each piglin champion killed, capping up to level 3-5. The higher the level the better loot you will receive when bartering with a piglin.
maybe there could be piglin crowds cheering on their champion!
also maybe it could have special attacks like a blackstone boulder toss, earthquake or a lunge!
Nice idea

Yeah that blackstone boulder toss would be a great attack to his kit to prevent players pillaring up and cheesing him! Could also add another attack called shield bash that knocks the player a few blocks away if the player gets too close to him or is attacking him in a row too much. The crowd cheering would also be an amazing addition too, makes the mini-boss fight super hyped up! Could make it that whenever the player enters the arena any piglins nearby would automatically path find they way to the seats up above and then being snorting and cheering!
Zombified Knights could live in these Abandoned Watchtowers and have Skeleton Horses in Ruined Stables right next to this tower.
There should be portals that put you in the nearest biome of the selected type and a special totem that can teleport you back to the tower.
i think "chillagers" should spawn hear to protect it, other wise this would be very OPd
Chillagers/Iceologers could also spawn here.
Or just not having the Evoker spawning in raids. The totem of undying should stay as the reward for beating a Woodland Mansion. A new reward should be added to raids.
It is hard to find these and I think we deserve an achievement besides diamonds and xp
ye i think the woodland mansion achievement would be a great idea and maybe one for visiting all structures?

we can have it be the old Minecraft villages under water with loot and a new drowned villager variant of a Minecraft zombie villager and they can have loot in the black smith like how it was back them but the lava and the torches would be gone and the farms can have kelp and sea grass along with other sea plants like that.

Wait, I never said that the amethyst temple should have a maze for treasure. and a bunch of traps in it and I thought of a block that could automatically spawn amethyst husks when you walk on it. there should be a new disk along with it called 22. I hope lena raine or C148 heard this.

Nah, I think this is too much, at least for now.
Minecraft (I repeat: for now) it's good with 3 dimensions, considering that one could use a little update

This seems much too far from Vanilla Minecraft to make sense, however, I do like your idea with the mobs that are related to the Amethyst Geodes. A new dimension is out of the question though because it would be expanding on something that requires farming making it really easy to get a rare material. 
A better way to go about it would be to add something like the Granite biomes in Terraria, (somewhat large caves made of only granite, diorite, and andesite) where mobs of there own type would spawn.
while I do like this idea it seems a little bit mody but maybe the amethyst mobs could spawn in the amethysts to protect them?
Want It Now

Instead of Magma Cubes, which should probably be left for the Nether, why not a Molten Ravager that tries to knock to into the lava? (It could have a fiery, molten body with a semi-obsidian head.) Also, this dungeon could be too hot, like the Nether, so water evaporates; this would prevent the player from easily getting rid of the lava threat.

I think you have a great dungeon concept that could be a fun challenge if added.
Thanks Indo Raptor, and I do love the molten ravager idea.

Good idea I tried making a Minecraft map and wanted to add a village but it was too hard you had to add the roads the buildings and all of the structures individually it's too hard to use for the average Minecraft player. it would be great if you could do a whole structure instead of just the pieces but there should still be a way to do individual parts of a structure.

It would be awesome to have traces of old civilization
In minecraft
I like this thought!
Like the idea but I dont think there should be diamonds leave it at like iron level max
I feel like it would be weird if the campsites were abandoned, maybe there could be some sort of wandering trader living at them instead.
You could find a wandering trader or a pillager army there
Maybe some geodes should be rich in different ores
Definetly a quartz one
Nive
Nive
The Underwater City should take inspiration from HL2's Ravenholm, and be themed around being a drowned-infested city. Both that and being underwater will further add to the creepiness.
When the archeology mechanics come to Minecraft, the brush should be used to search for treasure.
I had an idea for lava tubes where the walls might be obsidian and andesite and there woud be a higher chance of finding diamonds.
Also I think you should have put this post in the biomes categor .
Line the walls with a couple layers of basalt, have more lava springs, and increase the spawn rate and spawn level of diamonds.
From what I've seen with the new snapshot there is a huge lack of lava XD
